##  {#dashboardPage data-menu-title="dashboardPage()"}

<div class="slide-title-smaller">The most basic shinydashboard is made up of a header, a sidebar, and a body</div>

<p class="body-text">The main difference between a **shiny app** and a **shinydashboard** are the UI elements. Rather than a `fluidPage()` (as used in our previous shiny apps), we'll create a `dashboardPage()`, which expects three main parts: a header, a sidebar, and a body. Below is the most minimal possible UI for a `{shinydashboard}` page (you can run this code in an `app.R` file, if you wish).</p>

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="45%"}
```{r}
#| eval: false
#| echo: true
#..............................setup.............................
library(shiny)
library(shinydashboard)

#...............................ui...............................
ui <- dashboardPage(
  
  dashboardHeader(), 
  dashboardSidebar(), 
  dashboardBody() 
  
) 

#.............................server.............................
server <- function(input, output) {}

#......................combine ui & server.......................
shinyApp(ui, server)
```
:::
